intro: Pouzolzia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin, and are arranged alternately along the stems. Native to regions of Africa and the Middle East, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
